newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritian rupee firms vs dollar and stg.
newsitem.headline: Mauritian rupee firms vs dollar and stg.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee firmed against both the dollar and sterling on Thursday, reflecting international trends, foreign exchange dealers said.
The rupee was fixed at commercial mean rates of 20.554 to the dollar, from 20.5865 on Wednesday, and of 33.2545 to sterling, from 33.6925 on Wednesday.

"The dollar weakened against yen and mark in overnight international foreign exchange markets. It seems that the central banks of some industrialised countries are opting for a strong yen against the dollar," a dealer said.
Forex dealers said the local market was quiet as there was no hard currency buying intention from importers.
